guide.title: Gentoo Weekly Newsletter
guide.subtitle: 30 July 2007
guide.abstract: This is the Gentoo Weekly Newsletter for the week of 30 July 2007.

body.p: Necoro announced a GTK2+ based GUI for portage: Portato in the forums (albeit in German). This GUI was designed to help users when the CLI isn't sufficient. For example, when emerging a package with lots of dependencies and USE flags. This is made easier to do with a graphical frontend with the use of an Emerge Queue, which updates automatically and shows dependencies. Necoro stated that Portato wasn't meant as a replacementfor the CLI tools but is more comfortable in various situations.

Steve Dibb announced the Gentoo Planet Summer of Code 2007 site is up and running. Like the other two Planets Gentoo hosts, the feeds are updated hourly.
If you are a Gentoo mentor for this years Summer of Code and interested in having your own weblog, please send your info to Steve Dibb.

This years GUADEC, the GNOME Users' And Devleopers European Conference, was held at the UCE Birmingham Conservatoire, in Birmingham, England, from Sunday 15th July, until Saturday 21st of July 2007. The talks were divided in different categories, focusing on the future of GNOME, the preview and demonstration of existing technologies, as well as brainstorming sessions.
Of the topics floating around, great discussions included the GNOME Online Desktop, PyroDesktop, and interesting movement in the GTK+ area. $email out to tester re: more input$

This section lists packages that have either been moved or added to the tree and packages that have had their "last rites" announcement given to be removed in the future. The package removals come from many locations, including the Treecleaners and various developers. Most packages which are listed under the Last Rites section are in need of some love and care and can remain in the tree if proper maintainership is established.

The Gentoo community uses Bugzilla (bugs.gentoo.org) to record and track bugs, notifications, suggestions and other interactions with the development team. Between 22 July 2007 and 29 July 2007, activity on the site has resulted in:

ul.li: 526 new bugs during this period
350 bugs closed or resolved during this period
25 previously closed bugs were reopened this period
92 closed as NEEDINFO/WONTFIX/CANTFIX/INVALID/UPSTREAM during this period
83 bugs marked as duplicates during this period

body.p: Of the 9893 currently open bugs: 11 are labeled 'blocker', 110 are labeled 'critical', and 354 are labeled 'major'.
The developers and teams who have closed the most bugs during this period are:

ul.li: Gentoo Security, with 19 closed bugs
Gentoo Games, with 17 closed bugs

body.p: The GWN is staffed by volunteers and members of the community who submit ideas and articles. If you are interested in writing for the GWN, have feedback on an article that we have posted, or just have an idea or article that you would like to submit to the GWN, please send us your feedback and help make the GWN better.
